meta.description: Star Alliance Business Class Lounge at Los Angeles International Airport (LAX), International Terminal. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: Star Alliance Business Class Lounge

location.terminalDirections: Level 6, accessible via escalator or elevator from the main atrium area

location.description: QLA, Los Angeles, California, United States

lounge.description: Sit back, relax, and enjoy the world’s largest lounge network, the perfect place to escape from the hectic demands of travel. The Star Alliance Lounge provides an exclusive environment away from the hustle and bustle. Here, you can take time out and unwind before starting your journey or making a connection.

reviews.content: Decent food. Limited choice. Dirty and run down restrooms. Furniture has seen better days.
Very nice lounge with showers. Decent food and drinks too.
Solid lounge - not very crowded. Plenty of space to spread out. OK food selection. Very good drinks selection. Calm and quiet. Looking forward to comparing to upcoming United Polaris Lounge.
Make sure to check out the outdoor patio to grab some fresh air. Food could be better but all in all a top drawer Business Class Lounge.
Came in with low expectations but left very pleasantly impressed! Good food options, decent showers, not bad for a North American lounge in the dump that is LAX! 👍🏽
Fantastic lounge. Was there from 10 AM until noon. Lots of food options as well as self service beer, wine and cocktails. Used my United Club Card and UA boarding pass for a domestic flight to enter.
Great food spread, decent wine offerings, cool balcony. Add in a noodle bar with plenty of comfortable seating, and you’ll definitely want to get access into this lounge whenever possible. *A > UC
Service was excellent: everyone was friendly and efficient. Wifi was fast and the place is clean. Breakfast selection was limited but good quality. Outdoor deck was closed due to rain.
An amazing place to rest. It's what an Alliance Lounge should be.
Buena sala. Tiene todo para la espera del vuelo. Bebida, Comida.
Great option for Star flyers. Lounge can get quite busy at times with near mob scene surrounding food buffet area.
Best airport lounge in the US. Large, nice seating areas, comfortable chairs. Fast wifi. Plenty of power outlets. Really good food including a noodle station. Good selection of drinks.
This lounge has amazing food! When I was last there they had a make your own pho bar that is one of the single best food items I've ever seen in an airport in a lounge or in a restaurant.
Much better selection of food and drinks than expected.
Had high expectations but was met with an average lounge. Nothing special except for the outdoor terrace which is nice, especially if you're in transit.
This lounge has everything you need. Great food selection, showers, plenty of space and great service!
Love the terrace esp w the fire. Much less crowded than inside. Check out the noodle bar, doesn't compare to CX but delicious NTL.
Good food for vegetarians. very nice peach smoothie.
One of greatest lounges I have been to, I love the outdoor rooftop style area.
Really good food selection plus a noodle bar which is a refreshing change for the US. Accessible to Velocity Gold members traveling economy too. Good selection of wines and good coffee.
1st time in a lounge...thought it was swanky. Super nice...I love that they have showers and will beep you when there is a vacancy.
Good choices as to seating, including interesting outdoor zone. Food selection adequate, good wine choices. Bartender service promising but hardly seen when I was there. Excellent showers!
Pretty nice. Food has variety but not much. Mostly centered on Asian food. Lounge already looks packed at 2 pm. Not family friendly though. Can't find any beds to sleep.
In terms of layout, spaciousness and design, top notch. Slight ding on food choices and also difficulties in getting here if not in the international terminal. Worth a visit only if you're in TBIT.
More Asian than typical US lounge. Crowded with lots of shouting kids. Good food options and a neat outdoors deck. Showers.

Pretty good lounge. Decent food. Ramen setup is self service. Nothing great. Decent wifi. Reasonable selection of alcohol. Showers available. Outdoor deck is huge plus. Can get crowded during evening.
This lounge is possibly the best in the US. It has an amazing food spread and sitting areas. Love the overlook.
A kick-ass lounge to spend time before boarding. Large, airy, and ample seating. Be sure to try their smoothies and noodle soup bar!!!
Major upgrade from the old lounge.  Plenty of room, food and drinks.  Very clean and great service.
Brilliant lounge. Check out the outside terrace. Best lounge I've seen in the USA. Also looked into the first lounge - don't bother.
Amongst the best lounges available to Star Gold members in North America.
Food ok but repetitive as 3rd time in this lounge and same food. Comfortable and quiet.
Nice day place to spend a few hours, decent range of seating, food and beverages. Outdoor patio area is very pleasant when the weather is good - shared with the smokers of course.
Excellent setup. Comfy clean showers - if they provided hair spray, would be perfect. Plenty of room. Good food and alcohol.

Definitely better than the KAL Lounge. Wide selection of food available that is constantly being refreshed--no cold/stale food. Nice drinks and showers as well. Large capacity that can handle a crowd.
Perhaps the best lounge in the USA. Lots of space and the terrace is so great after a long flight while you're waiting for the next one!
Love this lounge! It has good food and noodles with sincere staff. Wifi is fast even when it's quite packed. The lounge is pretty busy at 10:30 or so but you can still find space for sure.
Quite busy during lunch time. There is a patio and shower rooms. Excellent food to eat. Wish priority pass can enter...
Really nice lounge, spacious, comfortable and quiet.
Excellent lounge at LAX! Great food, drink and views. Very clean and modern. Plenty of rooms and the terrace was awesome! Not many people here in the afternoon. I'm sure it's busy at night.
Went here for lunch, tasty selection: pasta and Vietnamese soup, various snacks, open self-service bar with very good premium selection. Lots of seating.
While the atmosphere the of the lounge is nice, the food is only so-so.
This is likely the best of the Star Alliance lounges. It's quiet, has fast internet, and offers decent food.

location.terminalDirections: After clearing TSA in TBIT, walk towards the bridge to the Great Hall and enter the elevator lobby on your left. Take the elevator from Level 4 to Level 2.
